name: Strawberry Shortcake Watermelon Pizza
author: Katherine Martinelli
summary: For a fun take on a classic summer entertaining dessert, try this simple strawberry shortcake watermelon pizza. You can use either store-bought or homemade whipped cream (or try a vegan whipped cream recipe). Either way, the key is to serve this right away as the whipped cream can melt pretty quickly.
ingredients: 8 ounces fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced
1  center-cut slice of watermelon, about 1 inch thick
1 cup whipped cream, or to taste
directions: Mix strawberries and sugar together in a medium bowl until the strawberries are thoroughly coated
Allow the strawberries to macerate for 10 to 20 minutes
Cut the round watermelon slice into 8 wedges, and keep them together
Pat dry with a paper towel or clean dish towel
Spray or spoon the whipped cream onto the center of the watermelon round; don't be afraid to pile it on, as the cream will sink under the weight of the strawberries
Spoon the macerated strawberries and their juices over the whipped cream and serve immediately
